Package org.apache.spark.sql.connector.read

Interface SupportsPushDownTopN

All Superinterfaces:
ScanBuilder
@Evolving public interface SupportsPushDownTopN extends ScanBuilder
A mix-in interface for ScanBuilder. Data sources can implement this interface to push down top N(query with ORDER BY ... LIMIT n). We can push down top N with many other operations if they follow the operator order we defined in ScanBuilder's class doc.
Since:
3.3.0

  • Method Details

    • pushTopN

      boolean pushTopN(SortOrder[] orders, int limit)
      Pushes down top N to the data source.

    • isPartiallyPushed

      default boolean isPartiallyPushed()
      Whether the top N is partially pushed or not. If it returns true, then Spark will do top N again. This method will only be called when pushTopN(org.apache.spark.sql.connector.expressions.SortOrder[], int) returns true.
